Question 1 Consider the following relational schema: [latex]
\text{Students} (\text{\underline{rollno: integer,} name: string, age: integer, cgpa: real})
[/latex] [latex]
\text{Courses} (\text{\underline{courseno: integer,} cname: string, credits: integer})
[/latex] [latex]
\text{Enrolled} (\text{ \underline{rollno: integer,} \underline{courseno: integer,} grade: string})
[/latex] Which of the following options is/are correct SQL query/queries to retrieve the names of the students enrolled in course number (i.e. courseno) 1470?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: SELECT S.name FROM Students S WHERE EXISTS (SELECT * FROM Enrolled E WHERE E.courseno = 1470 AND E.rollno = S.rollno)
options.B: SELECT S.name FROM Students S WHERE SIZEOF (SELECT * FROM Enrolled E WHERE E.courseno = 1470 AND E.rollno = S.rollno) > 0
options.C: SELECT S.name FROM Students S WHERE 0 < (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Enrolled E WHERE E.courseno = 1470 AND E.rollno = S.rollno)
options.D: SELECT S.name FROM Students S NATURAL JOIN Enrolled E WHERE E.courseno = 1470

question: Question 7 Consider two relations describing teams and players in a sports league: [latex]teams(tid, tname):tid, tname [/latex] are team-id and team-name, respectively [latex]players(pid, pname, tid):pid,pname,tid[/latex] denote player-id, player-name and the team-id of the player, respectively Which ONE of the following tuple relational calculus queries returns the name of the players who play for the team having name as 'MI'?
